div.pre: <Namespace xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir"> <!-- from Resource: extension, modifierExtension, language, text, and contained --> <type value="[code]"/><!-- 1..1 codesystem | identifier | root --> <label value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Human-readable name --> <status value="[code]"/><!-- 1..1 proposed | active | retired --> <country value="[code]"/><!-- 0..1 ISO 3-char country code --> <category><!-- 0..1 CodeableConcept driver | provider | patient | bank --></category> <description value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 What does namespace identify? --> <usage value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 How/where is it used --> <uniqueId> <!-- 1..* Unique identifiers used for system --> <type value="[code]"/><!-- 1..1 oid | uuid | uri | ruid --> <value value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 The unique identifier --> <preferred value="[boolean]"/><!-- 0..1 Is this the id that should be used for this type --> <period><!-- 0..1 Period When is identifier valid? --></period> </uniqueId> <responsible><!-- 0..1 Resource(Organization) Who maintains system namespace? --></responsible> <contact> <!-- 0..1 Who should be contacted for questions about namespace --> <name><!-- 0..1 HumanName Name of person --></name> <telecom><!-- 0..* Contact Phone, email, etc. --></telecom> </contact> </Namespace>

description.value: Basic Profile. A curated namespace that issues unique symbols within that namespace for the identification of concepts, people, devices, etc. Represents a "System" used within the Identifier and Coding data types.

requirements.value: Scope and Usage Defines a specific code system or identifier system

formal.value: A curated namespace that issues unique symbols within that namespace for the identification of concepts, people, devices, etc. Represents a "System" used within the Identifier and Coding data types.

human.value: Can't have more than one preferred identifier for a type

xpath.value: not(exists(for $type in distinct-values(f:uniqueId/f:type) return if (count(f:uniqueId[f:type/@value=$type and f:primary/@value='true'])>1) then $type else ()))

human.value: Root systems cannot have uuid or sid identifiers

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

short.value: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

formal.value: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

comments.value: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

formal.value: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

comments.value: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

formal.value: Indicates the purpose for the namespace - what kinds of things does it make unique?.

description.value: Identifies the purpose of the namespace

formal.value: The name of this particular identifier or code system.

comments.value: The"symbolic name" would be captured as an extension.

formal.value: Indicates whether the namespace is "ready for use" or not.

description.value: Indicates whether the namespace should be used

formal.value: If present, indicates that the identifier or code system is principally intended for use or applies to entities within the specified country. For example, the country associated with a national code system.
Categorizes a namespace for easier search by grouping related namespaces.

comments.value: This will most commonly be used for identifier namespaces, but categories could potentially be useful for code systems and authorities as well.

description.value: Identifies the general purpose of the namespace identifiers provided

formal.value: Details about what the namespace identifies including scope, granularity, etc.
Provides guidance on the use of the namespace, including the handling of formatting characters, use of upper vs. lower case, etc.
Indicates how the system may be identified when referenced in electronic exchange.

comments.value: Multiple identifiers may exist, either due to duplicate registration, regional rules, needs of different communication technologies, etc.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: Identifies the unique identifier scheme used for this particular identifier.

comments.value: Different identifier types may be used in different types of communications (OIDs for v3, URIs for FHIR, etc.).

description.value: Identifies the style of unique identifier used to identify a namepace

formal.value: The string that should be sent over the wire to identify the code system or identifier system.

short.value: Is this the id that should be used for this type

formal.value: Indicates whether this identifier is the "preferred" identifier of this type.
Identifies the period of time over which this identifier is considered appropriate to refer to the namespace. Outside of this window, the identifier might be non-deterministic.

comments.value: Within a registry, a given identifier should only be "active" for a single namespace at a time. (Ideally, an identifier should only ever be associated with a single namespace across all time).

formal.value: The organization that is responsible for issuing identifiers or codes for this namespace and ensuring their non-collision.

comments.value: This is the primary organization. Responsibility for some aspects of a namespace may be delegated.

short.value: Who should be contacted for questions about namespace

formal.value: The person who can be contacted about this system registration entry.

formal.value: Names of the person who can be contacted.
Identifies the mechanism(s) by which they can be contacted.

documentation.value: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)
